questions.text: A researcher wants to do a study of blood level of lipids among people who smoke & those who don’t. But he is now concerned that the smokers might differ from non-smokers in their diet, exercise, etc. as well. This concern is known as:

A new estrogen receptor agonist is being evaluated for the treatment of postmenopausal symptoms. A prospective study shows that drug increases the risk of DVT in treated women who smoke compared to untreated women who smoke, with a RR of 1.7 & p value of 0.01. In non-smokers, no increased risk of DVT is evident with use of drug (RR = 0.96, p value = 0.06). Which of the following describes the phenomenon?
What is the RR of acquiring TB in households with a culture-positive case compared with households without TB?
Which is not true for case control study?

options.label: B
options.text: Can be used for rare outcome

questions.correct_answer: C. Multiple outcomes can be studied

questions.text: A cohort of healthy individual at risk of developing a disease were chosen and followed over a period of 5-years period. During this time, 5 cases develop—1 case after 1 year, 1 after 2 years, 2 after 4 years, and 1 after 5 years. Each time a case or cases developed, same no. Of control was chosen from the same cohort. Identify the type of study:

Doctor 1 diagnoses cervical cancer using PAP smear and mean age of diagnosis is 40 years, gives available treatment and patients die at 60 years. Doctor 2 diagnoses cervical cancer using a new screening test (Y) and mean age of diagnosis is 35 years, gives available treatment and patients die at 60 years. As compared to the doctor 1; doctor 2 has provided patient:
A diagnostic test has been in use for decades. However, with improvement in hygiene the prevalence of the disease falls from 35% to 5%. Which of the statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Change in prevalence will reduce the predictive value of a negative result

options.label: B
options.text: Predictive value of a positive result will decline

options.label: C
options.text: Specificity of the test is likely to decline

options.label: D
options.text: Specificity will increase at expense of its sensitivity

questions.correct_answer: B. Predictive value of a positive result will decline

questions.text: A blood test reveals that a 35-year-old woman at 18 weeks gestation has increased serum alpha fetoprotein. Of the following measures, which has the greatest influence in determining the predictive value of this test for NTD in foetus?

options.label: A
options.text: Absolute concentration of AFP in maternal serum

options.label: B
options.text: Family history of dizygotic twin pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Prevalence of NTD defects in the population in the question

questions.correct_answer: C. Prevalence of NTD defects in the population in the question

questions.text: A screening test is used in same way in 2 similar populations, but the proportion of false positive results among those who test positive in population A is lower than among those who test positive in population B. What is the likely explanation for this finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Specificity of test is lower in population A

options.label: B
options.text: Prevalence of disease is lower in population A

options.label: C
options.text: Prevalence of disease is higher in population A

options.label: D
options.text: Specificity of the test is higher in population A

questions.correct_answer: C. Prevalence of disease is higher in population A

questions.text: If hemoccult test is negative for screening of colonic cancer, no further test is done. If hemoccult test is positive individual will have a 2nd stool sample tested with hemoccult 2 test. If this 2nd test is positive for blood then individual will be referred for more extensive evaluation. Effect of net sensitivity & net specificity of this method of screening is:

options.label: B
options.text: Net sensitivity is decreased & net specificity is increased

options.label: C
options.text: Net sensitivity is increased & net specificity is increased

options.label: D
options.text: Net sensitivity remain the same & net specificity is increased

questions.correct_answer: B. Net sensitivity is decreased & net specificity is increased
